<FI>A Psalm<Fi> of David. Plead <FI>my cause<Fi>, O LORD, with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.
Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.
Draw out also the spear, and stop <FI>the way<Fi> against them that persecute me: say unto my soul, I <FI>am<Fi> thy salvation.
Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul: let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.
Let them be as chaff before the wind: and let the angel of the LORD chase <FI>them<Fi>.
Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the LORD persecute them.<RF>dark…: Heb. darkness and slipperiness<Rf>
For without cause have they hid for me their net <FI>in<Fi> a pit, <FI>which<Fi> without cause they have digged for my soul.
Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he hath hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall.<RF>at…: Heb. which he knoweth not of<Rf>
And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
All my bones shall say, LORD, who <FI>is<Fi> like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?<CM>
False witnesses did rise up; they laid to my charge <FI>things<Fi> that I knew not.<RF>False…: Heb. Witnesses of wrong<Rf><RF>they…: Heb. they asked me<Rf>
They rewarded me evil for good <FI>to<Fi> the spoiling of my soul.<RF>spoiling: Heb. depriving<Rf>
But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing <FI>was<Fi> sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom.<RF>humbled: or, afflicted<Rf>

I behaved myself as though <FI>he had been<Fi> my friend <FI>or<Fi> brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth <FI>for his<Fi> mother.<RF>behaved myself: Heb. walked<Rf><RF>as though…: Heb. as a friend, as a brother to me<Rf>

But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: <FI>yea<Fi>, the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew <FI>it<Fi> not; they did tear <FI>me<Fi>, and ceased not:<RF>adversity: Heb. halting<Rf>
With hypocritical mockers in feasts, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.<CM>
Lord, how long wilt thou look on? rescue my soul from their destructions, my darling from the lions.<RF>darling: Heb. only one<Rf>
I will give thee thanks in the great congregation: I will praise thee among much people.<RF>much: Heb. strong<Rf>
Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: <FI>neither<Fi> let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.<RF>wrongfully: Heb. falsely<Rf>
For they speak not peace: but they devise deceitful matters against <FI>them that are<Fi> quiet in the land.
Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me, <FI>and<Fi> said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen <FI>it<Fi>.
<FI>This<Fi> thou hast seen, O LORD: keep not silence: O Lord, be not far from me.
Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment, <FI>even<Fi> unto my cause, my God and my Lord.
Judge me, O LORD my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.
Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it: let them not say, We have swallowed him up.<RF>Ah…: Heb. Ah, ah, our soul<Rf>
Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify <FI>themselves<Fi> against me.

Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the LORD be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.<RF>righteous…: Heb. righteousness<Rf>
And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness <FI>and<Fi> of thy praise all the day long.<CM>
